abstract: The Nintendo 3DS provides 3-D images without the need for the special glasses, while Sony relies on its specially equipped TV sets.
snippet: The Nintendo 3DS provides 3-D images without the need for the special glasses, while Sony relies on its specially equipped TV sets.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  With Microsoft and Sony looking to leap ahead of Nintendo’s Wii motion-control video game technology, Nintendo took off in another direction on Tuesday with a 3-D portable game device.

headline.main: Nintendo and Sony Show Competing Visions for 3-D at a Video Game Convention
headline.print_headline: Nintendo and Sony Show Competing Visions for 3-D at a Video Game Convention

abstract: As Microsoft gives software away online for the first time, Xobni builds boxed software to sell in stores.
snippet: As Microsoft gives software away online for the first time, Xobni builds boxed software to sell in stores.
lead_paragraph: For the first time, Microsoft, which has always sold its Office software in boxes, is providing Office 2010 free on the Web. Meanwhile, Xobni, which has always offered its Microsoft Outlook add-on free on the Web, is for the first time selling boxed software in stores.

headline.main: Xobni Takes a Retro Approach and Sells Boxed Software

abstract: According to statistics from Nielsen, a market research firm, people are now spending 22 percent of their online time on social Web sites or blogs.
snippet: According to statistics from Nielsen, a market research firm, people are now spending 22 percent of their online time on social Web sites or blogs.
lead_paragraph: Messaging, commenting, blogging, sharing and “liking” now fill up 22 percent of all time spent online each month, according to Nielsen, a market research firm.

headline.main: 22 Percent of Internet Time Is Social, Nielsen Says

abstract: Documents To Go and Quickoffice Connect Mobile Suite will not replace a laptop, but will allow iPad users to work away from the office.
snippet: Documents To Go and Quickoffice Connect Mobile Suite will not replace a laptop, but will allow iPad users to work away from the office.
lead_paragraph: When the iPad arrived, I considered it a great tool for nonworking hours, mostly because my job revolves around Microsoft Office and Adobe PDF files. Apple’s iWork software for the iPad did not work seamlessly enough with those files, and nothing else had yet reached the App Store.

headline.main: Documents Can Be Summoned at a Touch With 2 iPad Apps
headline.print_headline: Documents Can Be Summoned at a Touch With 2 iPad Apps
